intro: Pentarrhinum tylophoroides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience in various environmental conditions.
